titles.title: Run If You Want To; Run If You Will

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
The champion marched for forty days
Sayin', Send me a man to fight!
The Israelites said, I've got a brave heart,
But my feet are full of fright!
A boy with a sling and pocket full of rocks
Who know how to trust and pray
If you're gonna run, Goliath, you better run now,
Cause I came here to stay.
Chorus:
Run if you want to; run if you will;
But, I came here to stay.
If I fall down, I'm gonna get up.
I didn't start out to play.
It's a battlefield, brother,
Not a recreation room.
It's a fight and not a game.
Run if you want to; run if you will;
But, I came here to stay.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
The boys wouldn't bow,
And the king got mad.
So he said, Turn the furnace up high.
Tie 'em up and throw 'em in.
These Hebrew boys are gonna fry.
A little while later he looked in the flame;
He heard Shadrach say,
Pull up a chair, boys, and warm your hands
'Cause we came here to stay.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
The decree had been signed by the hand of the king;
But, Daniel still talked to the Lord.
Hungry lions were pacing their den,
Here comes supper, one roared.
But, if you'd been around anywhere close
You'd have heard Daniel say,
If you're talking 'bout me, you can forget it, boys
'Cause I came here to stay.
